titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: I presided at a Chapter meeting. We appointed Cook to Spennymoor: and Kearney to South Shields, S. Stephen's. The Chapter agreed to removing the standards in front of the Altar, & substituting light from the walls.
In the afternoon we motored to Wynyard in order to spend the week–end with the Londonderrys
. On the way we stopped at Sedgefield, & called on M
Derry. She & the Archdeacon dined at Wynyard. The company also included Lord & Lady Boyne, both very pleasant especially the last.
